intro: Escallonia stenopetala, commonly known as the narrow-petaled escallonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact shrub form and dense foliage. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Escallonia stenopetala thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
